intro: Cyrtandra hirta, commonly known as the hairy cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Cyrtandra hirta is often found growing in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian flora.
